intro: Cryptophragmium polyanthum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves and produces bulbous structures that store nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its attractive appearance, it is sometimes considered an invasive species in regions outside its native range.
